item.title: God Part 3
item.description:
From the Dimentia 13 album "Flat Earth Society" (Midnight Records, 1990) GOD PART 3 by Brad Warner
God, he's the guy I look up to in the sky God, he's the man with the plan you'll be damned if you don't follow You can be blessed, don't transgress, your success depends on it Not a bit, it is writ, so use your wit and... You'll be fine all the time Creating time and nursery rhymes
God looks like this, looks like that, I think he's getting fat He's a cat, or a rat, or a man in a strawberry hat So watch what you say, if you're gay he might blow you away Or if you're a priest, he'll at least threaten to make you deceased But you'll be fine all the time Creating time and nursery rhymes
And when I die, and when my body's cremated Then will I get reincarnated Or will I burn in some kind of hell Or turn to nothing, cuz that's just as well
God, who are you? Are you blue like all those Hare Krishnas say? Or perhaps you're a man in a robe whose hair is going gray Or maybe you're formless and nameless like all of those mystics said or else you're a ghost, or a host, or (like Fred said) maybe you are dead But you'll be fine all the time Because you're God and what else can you be?

God, he's the guy I look up to in the sky God, he's the man with the plan you'll be damned if you don't follow You can be blessed, don't transgress, your success depends on it Not a bit, it is writ, so use your wit and... You'll be fine all the time Creating time and nursery rhymes

God, who are you? Are you blue like all those Hare Krishnas say? Or perhaps you're a man in a robe whose hair is going gray Or maybe you're formless and nameless like all of those mystics said or else you're a ghost, or a host, or (like Fred said) maybe you are dead But you'll be fine all the time Because you're God and what else can you be?
